stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on building the Western-style “Boshi duel” miniboss: a cut-scene countdown, gun prop, egg-throw animation, reaction-time logic and camera work, while checking recent N64 performance fixes and discussing future release/DMCA strategy.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a Boshi duel mechanic: cut-scene shows Boshi and Mario, randomized 3-2-1-fire cue, reaction-time check (starts ~280 ms, adds 3 frames on each failure); early shots explode in Mario’s face.
development_findings.quote: I’m thinking there will be a countdown here that says 3, 2, 1 and then there’s a random delay and it says go, and you gotta press B to shoot him.

development_findings.summary: Switched from HUD numbers to a full cut-scene camera (focus on Boshi → Mario → zoom-out) to simplify code and look more cinematic.
development_findings.quote: Let’s just make a cutscene, fuck it—this is painful to do without a cutscene.

development_findings.summary: Attached a cork-gun model to Mario by rendering an invisible duplicate Mario rig that only keeps the hand bone, avoiding costly per-frame matrix capture.
development_findings.quote: I can copy Mario’s rig, make only the hand visible where the hand is the gun—most performant solution.

development_findings.summary: Created Boshi’s egg-juggle animation; calculated frame-by-frame deceleration/acceleration math to sync the egg with Boshi’s hand.
development_findings.quote: We’re doing the math here… 13 frames of deceleration, 4 frames of acceleration.

development_findings.summary: Engine now runs 40 FPS on real N64 in Course 5; overworld still crashes; plans to cull unseen beams for speed.
development_findings.quote: Hey! 40 FPS before we even optimized it… Don’t worry though about the overworld crash—we knew something was wrong.

development_findings.summary: Recent property system causes a temporary 20 % perf loss; once fixed Kaze expects a 5–10 % gain.
development_findings.quote: Right now it’s a 20 % performance loss, but once everything’s fixed I’m expecting 5–10 % performance gain.

development_findings.summary: Found miscellaneous micro-optimisations and received a promising new sine/cos approximation from a viewer email.
development_findings.quote: Someone just emailed me a new sine and cosine approximation that might actually be worth it.

development_findings.summary: Game scope update: ~180 stars planned; only three levels left (final 20 % of production).
development_findings.quote: Do you guys actually realize how crazy it is how close we’re done… only three levels are missing.

development_findings.summary: All future projects will use his custom engine; polished it while prepping a small, secret ROM-hack release.
development_findings.quote: Basically everything I’m going to release is going to use my engine… I also polished up the entire engine for it.

development_findings.summary: Uses Blender over 3ds Max for speed, Python hooks and open-source longevity.
development_findings.quote: Blender is fast, has 64-bit and Python capabilities, and it’s open source, which means it’s actually going to be good in five years.

context_findings.summary: Strong distrust of Nintendo’s copyright policy; ~70 of his prior videos were struck, believes it stunted channel growth.
context_findings.quote: Had Nintendo not interfered, I would have a million subs by now—no exaggeration.

context_findings.summary: Will pair the game’s trailer with a Kickstarter for his next project and prepare a copyright-free version to survive takedowns.
context_findings.quote: They will absolutely take it down, and I will have to release a copyright-free version—that is gonna happen and you know it.

context_findings.summary: Wants to avoid releasing near major Nintendo launches to reduce DMCA risk.
context_findings.quote: If you release your ROM-hack around the same time as a big Nintendo game comes out, you are going to get taken down 100 %.

context_findings.summary: Lighthearted frustration with home noise (“gates of hell” fan) and stream audio issues; switches to NVIDIA Broadcast mid-stream.
context_findings.quote: Peace and quiet—I’m safe… the gates of hell have opened in my house.

context_findings.summary: Brief remark on Zeina doing childcare instead of development, hinting at work-life balance tension.
context_findings.quote: Can you believe Zeina’s on babysitting instead of making games with me right now?

biobak.summary: Pops in; Kaze says Biobak will review and improve his models after initial pass.
biobak.quote: I do all the models by myself… but usually after I’m done, we got Biobak looking over it and he makes them a lot better.

zeina.summary: Absent this session; Kaze notes she is busy babysitting, suggesting her animation work is momentarily on hold.
zeina.quote: Such is life… Zeina’s on babysitting instead of making games with me right now.

key_stories.title: Designing the Boshi Showdown
key_stories.summary: Kaze turns a simple ‘Yoshi with a gun’ gag into a timing-based miniboss. Early HUD-based countdown proved ugly, so he rebuilt it as a cinematic cut-scene, added egg-throw animation, a cork-gun prop, and variable difficulty reaction timing.
key_stories.challenge: Create an engaging duel on N64 hardware with expressive feedback.
key_stories.process: Prototyped HUD numbers → switched to cut-scene; hand-animated egg; calculated timing math; attached gun via invisible rig for speed.
key_stories.outcome: Visuals, camera, and basic logic finished; shooting mechanic slated for next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Let’s just make a cutscene, fuck it—this is painful to do without a cutscene.

key_stories.title: Chasing Real-Hardware Performance
key_stories.summary: While preparing a small secret hack, Kaze refactored his engine and tested Return to Yoshi’s Island on a real N64, hitting 40 FPS in Course 5 but discovering overworld crashes.
key_stories.challenge: Maintain stable framerate and memory on original console.
key_stories.process: Polished engine, profiled levels, planned culling for heavy geometry; logged crash for later fix.
key_stories.outcome: Confident baseline performance; specific overworld issues remain.
key_stories.key_quote: 40 FPS before we even optimized it… maybe one day the overworld will work—today is not today.

key_stories.title: Living Under the DMCA Sword
key_stories.summary: Past strikes wiped 70 videos, so Kaze strategizes for inevitable takedowns: stagger release away from Nintendo launches, ship a copyright-free trailer, and bundle it with a Kickstarter.
key_stories.challenge: Release a high-profile Mario 64 hack without losing visibility.
key_stories.process: Recounts prior removals, studies Nintendo patterns, plans dual-trailer approach, refuses Patreon paywall to avoid perception issues.
key_stories.outcome: Clear but fragile release roadmap; still debating open-source and exact timing.
key_stories.key_quote: They will absolutely take it down… I’ll have to release a copyright-free version.
